page.title: 01GENERAL INFORMATION
page.content: The area is divided into two by the Woodbury,Walsgrove and Merritts Hills. On the western side affinities go towards the Shelsleys while on the eastern side is the village of Great Witley.On the western side the land is completely given to farming,whereas on the eastern side there has been considerable residential development, particularly between the Stourport and Witley Roads below the Abberley Hill.Many of the older houses once part of the Witley Court estate have been extended and now house families who have moved into the area. There is council housing provision for pensioners and others. There is a village hall and a public house.There are two schools,the local primary school and a private preparatory school.There is a police station and a post office and village shop.
